unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Uttar Pradesh**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Uttar Pradesh**

unnormalised: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh – Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, targeting installation in all major cities by Q4 2024. The initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (AT&C) losses, a persistent challenge for DISCOMs in the region.
normalised: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh – U P P C L is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, targeting installation in all major cities by Q four two thousand and twenty four. The initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, a persistent challenge for D I S C O M s in the region.

unnormalised: Pilot projects conducted in Agra and Varanasi have reportedly shown promising results, with a reduction in power theft by an estimated 20% according to preliminary data released on 10/11/2023. Consumers will benefit from real-time consumption monitoring through a dedicated mobile app, enabling better energy management and potential cost savings.
normalised: Pilot projects conducted in Agra and Varanasi have reportedly shown promising results, with a reduction in power theft by an estimated twenty percent according to preliminary data released on tenth november two thousand and twenty three. Consumers will benefit from real-time consumption monitoring through a dedicated mobile app, enabling better energy management and potential cost savings.

unnormalised: “We are committed to providing reliable and affordable electricity to all consumers,” stated a UPPCL spokesperson during a press briefing held at 11:00 hrs yesterday. The spokesperson further added that advanced meter infrastructure (AMI) will facilitate improved grid management and quicker fault detection. The project, estimated at Rs. 12,000 crores, is partly funded by a central government scheme and is expected to be completed by 31/12/2025. The benefits should become increasingly clear to the average consumer by Diwali next year, they emphasized.
normalised: “We are committed to providing reliable and affordable electricity to all consumers,” stated a U P P C L spokesperson during a press briefing held at eleven zero zero hours yesterday. The spokesperson further added that advanced meter infrastructure (A M I) will facilitate improved grid management and quicker fault detection. The project, estimated at rupee twelve thousand crore, is partly funded by a central government scheme and is expected to be completed by thirty first december two thousand and twenty five. The benefits should become increasingly clear to the average consumer by Diwali next year, they emphasized.
